Pre-Game Insights: Bermuda captain Delray Rawlins is not fixated on Canada, their opponents in the opening match of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup Americas Regional Qualifier at White Hill Field.
Canada are the favourites to come out on top based on ICC rankings, with Canada ranked nineteenth and Bermuda in 32nd place.
Canada arrived on the island from a camp in the United States a day earlier than Cayman Islands and Panama, allowing them an extra training session.
Rawlins acknowledged that facing Canada is a tricky assignment but remains confident in his team's abilities.
Rawlins emphasized that T20 cricket presents every team with a chance to succeed, and he is confident in his team's preparation and knowledge of home conditions.
Rawlins expressed happiness about playing Canada first, citing good preparation and training leading up to the match.
Niraj Odedra's side is not solely relying on home conditions but also on the team's overall preparation and performance throughout the summer.
Bermuda has never been to a T20 World Cup, and the current players have a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to make history.
Rawlins highlighted the significance of qualifying for the World Cup and urged fans to support the team.
